Module kivakit.core.kernel
Package com.telenav.kivakit.core.kernel.messaging.broadcasters

Class Multicaster

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.telenav.kivakit.core.kernel.messaging.broadcasters.Multicaster
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Transmitter<Transmittable>, NamedObject, PackagePathed, Broadcaster, Transceiver
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BaseRepeater, LineReader, Progress
    public class Multicaster
extends java.lang.Object
implements Broadcaster, PackagePathed
    A multicaster is a broadcaster which can have more than one listener. As with any broadcaster, listeners can be added to a multicaster with Broadcaster.addListener(Listener) and can be cleared with clearListeners(). Messages can be broadcast to all listeners with transmit(Transmittable).

    If a class is already extending some other base class (and since Java does not support mix-ins) an instance of Multicaster can be aggregated and its methods delegated to implement the Broadcaster interface This is not automatic in Java, but requires a minimal amount of code: 

     public class A extends B implements Repeater<Message>
 {
     private final BaseRepeater<Message> repeater = new BaseRepeater<>();

     public void broadcast(final Message message)
     {
         this.repeater.broadcast(message);
     }

     public void broadcastTo(final Listener<Message> listener)
     {
         this.repeater.broadcastTo(listener);
     }

     public void clearListeners()
     {
         this.repeater.clearListeners();
     }

     public boolean hasListeners()
     {
         return this.repeater.hasListeners();
     }
 }
    Author:
    jonathanl (shibo)
    See Also:
    Broadcaster, Listener

        public void addListener​(Listener listener,
                        Filter<Transmittable> filter)
        Adds a listener to this broadcaster that wants to receive future messages. This is the mirror method of Listener.listenTo(Broadcaster) as both methods achieve the same thing.
